results.title: Cricket: Australian style
results.creator_credit: Neil Howe, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A documentary on cricket as it is played in Australia in 1974. Offers highlights from a match between Australia and New Zealand and presents comments about the game by the then Australian captain Ian Chappell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Neil Howe, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Picturesque Tasmania
results.creator_credit: G Gamon and Australia. Dept of Commerce. Cinema Branch
results.brief_description: Produced by the Cinema Branch, Australian Department of Commerce. A driving tour of Tasmania from Hobart along the western, northern, eastern and southern coasts focussing on the natural scenery. A number of towns and their various industries can also be seen such as trout hatcheries, the Mt Lyell mine, hops and apple growing. Source: NFSA Film Australia Collection.

results.title: Will the Great Barrier Reef cure Claude Clough
results.creator_credit: John Milson, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A travel film with a difference. Claude Clough, frustrated and depressed, consults a psychiatrist who prescribes a holiday on the Great Barrier Reef. Underwater photography shows some of the dazzling coral formations and reefs and the striking scenery of the reef islands. A satirical fantasy on the theme of a holiday on the Great Barrier Reef.

results.title: Guide to Canberra
results.creator_credit: Colin Dean and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Produced by the Commonwealth Film Unit in 1958, ‘Guide to Canberra’ was initially intended to inform public servants transferring to Canberra about the lifestyle that they could expect to find in our nation’s growing capital. The glowing report that ensues takes the viewer on a tour of the city’s significant sites, its relaxed shopping districts and new suburban homes, offering a snapshot of Canberra at a time when its population was just 40,000 strong. With its planned transport network, new schools, established retailers and infant café culture, Canberra is depicted as a modern and prosperous city, all the more appealing for the sense of balance afforded by its graceful bushland setting. Whether you view our nation’s capital with affection, indifference or antipathy, this upbeat film leaves little room for doubt that Canberra is unlike any other city in Australia.

results.title: Timboon Consolidated School
results.creator_credit: E.J. Perry and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Makes an argument for the consolidation of local small rural schools into large purpose built centralised establishments with a post-primary school element. Presents the organisational elements involved: bussing, staffing, design, curriculum etc.

results.title: Heartbeat
results.creator_credit: Artransa Films, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian Road Safety Council
results.brief_description: The heartbeat under normal conditions is shown. A young couple go to an entertainment where there is exciting music and alcohol. Driving away they suffer a fatal accident. The gentleman’s heartbeat is reflected in the tempo of a jazz quartet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Artransa Films, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian Road Safety Council

results.title: Australian diary. No. 001
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following itms are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: seventy 16 footer class yachts race on Sydney Harbour; cattle being sold at Wodonga after travelling on the hoof; pineapple harvesting in Queensland; an expert and his children demonstrate boomerang throwing; the University of Western Australia and St. George’s College are shown; surfriding on huge seas at Manly is shown.

results.title: By-pass
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A short film illustrating a typical administrative problem for discussion. Two office workers produce innovative designs that may prove to have long range cost-saving benefits. Neither of their superiors appears to be appreciative. One designer decides to by-pass his approach to his superior. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Country school teacher
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the life and work of a typical country school teacher in a one teacher school near Lismore, NSW. The teacher is shown teaching his varied class, leading them in games, and taking a useful place in the rural community. The film points out that isolation is one the main difficulties for a rural teacher, showing a conference attended by many such teachers to discuss their problems. Photography by George Lowe. Music by the East Lismore school choir.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 007
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: British migrants are welcomed to their new homes; in particular tradespeople arriving in Australia. Australian designers show their talents by designing garments in local wool and cotton and parading them in a Sydney department store. Ex-servicemen and women form a musical society - Melbourne services Commemoration Musical Society. Nicotine sulphate made fromplants grown in Victoria is extracted by scientists to form an insecticide to protect other plants. Surf Life Saving Clubs from around Australia compete at the national Cahmpionships held in Southport, Queensland.
